page.title: 06MICHELMERSH CHURCH
page.content: A small village on rising ground to the east of the Test. {CHURCH : St Mary's, 12c, built of flint and stone, roofed with peg tiles. Situated to the N of the village, at it's highest point 80m above sea level The S. door, N and S chapels are 12c, chancel 13c, S facade built in 1847. The W tower, with a pyramid roof, is timber framed and weather_boarded added in 15c. As it needs repair its bells are no longer rung. The interior contains a 13c stone font and 14c effigy of a knight, lying cross_ legged, feet on a stag, and believed to be Geoffrey de Canterton. As the vicar also serves Braishfield, Timsbury and Farley Chamberlayne, services are rotated between all four churches. St Mary's congregation: 12 to 15.
